events.originalText: The National Movement for the Liberation of Azawad unilaterally declared the region of Azawad independent from Mali.
events.subtitle: National Movement for the Liberation of Azawad
events.headline: Azawad Declares Independence from Mali

events.originalText: Naxalite–Maoist insurgency: Insurgents from the Communist Party of India (Maoist) ambushed a Central Reserve Police Force convoy in Dantewada district, India, killing 76 officers.
events.subtitle: Naxalite–Maoist insurgency
events.headline: 76 Officers Killed in Maoist Ambush in India

events.originalText: Mass protests began across Moldova against the results of the parliamentary election.
events.subtitle: April 2009 Moldovan parliamentary election protests
events.headline: Mass Protests Erupt in Moldova

events.originalText: An earthquake measuring 6.3 Mw struck near L'Aquila in the central Italian region of Abruzzo, killing 308 people and leaving more than 66,000 homeless.
events.subtitle: 2009 L'Aquila earthquake
events.headline: Earthquake in L'Aquila Kills 308

events.originalText: Egyptian workers staged an illegal general strike, two days before key municipal elections.
events.subtitle: 2008 Egyptian general strike
events.headline: Egyptian Workers Stage Illegal Strike

events.originalText: Kurdish leader Jalal Talabani (pictured) was elected by the National Assembly as the first non-Arab president of Iraq.
events.subtitle: Kurds
events.headline: Jalal Talabani Elected First Non-Arab President of Iraq

events.originalText: Lithuanian president Rolandas Paksas became the first European head of state to be removed from office by impeachment.
events.subtitle: Rolandas Paksas
events.headline: Lithuanian President Impeached and Removed from Office

events.originalText: The aircraft carrying Rwandan president Juvénal Habyarimana (pictured) and Burundian president Cyprien Ntaryamira was shot down in Kigali; the event became the catalyst for the Rwandan genocide.
events.subtitle: Juvénal Habyarimana
events.headline: Rwandan President's Aircraft Shot Down in Kigali

events.originalText: Four California Highway Patrol officers were killed in a shootout following a traffic stop in Newhall, north of Los Angeles.
events.subtitle: California Highway Patrol
events.headline: Four CHP Officers Killed in Newhall Shootout

events.originalText: Second World War: The Battle of Slater's Knoll on Bougainville Island concluded with a decisive victory for the Australian Army's 7th Brigade against the Imperial Japanese Army's 6th Division.
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: Australian Army Victorious in Battle of Slater's Knoll

events.originalText: World War II: German forces invaded Greece.
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: German Forces Invade Greece in WWII

events.originalText: World War II: The Luftwaffe began Operation Retribution, bombing the Yugoslav capital of Belgrade in retaliation for a coup d'état that overthrew the government that had signed the Tripartite Pact.
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: Luftwaffe Bombs Belgrade in Retaliation

events.originalText: Joseph Smith, Oliver Cowdery, David Whitmer and others formally organized the Church of Christ, starting the Latter Day Saint movement.
events.subtitle: Joseph Smith
events.headline: Church of Christ Organized by Joseph Smith and Others

events.originalText: Peninsular War: After a three-week siege, the Anglo-Portuguese Army, under the Earl of Wellington, captured Badajoz, Spain, and forced the surrender of the French garrison.
events.subtitle: Peninsular War
events.headline: Wellington Captures Badajoz in Peninsular War

events.originalText: Napoleonic Wars: British forces captured the French frigate Niémen in the Bay of Biscay.
events.subtitle: Napoleonic Wars
events.headline: British Forces Capture French Frigate Niémen

events.originalText: John Jacob Astor founded the American Fur Company, the profits from which made him the first multi-millionaire in the United States.
events.subtitle: John Jacob Astor
events.headline: John Jacob Astor Found American Fur Company

events.originalText: American Revolutionary War: Ships of the Continental Navy unsuccessfully attempted to capture HMS Glasgow near Block Island.
events.subtitle: American Revolutionary War
events.headline: Continental Navy Fails to Capture HMS Glasgow

events.originalText: A group of 23 slaves in New York City revolted, setting fire to a building, but were soon recaptured.
events.subtitle: New York Slave Revolt of 1712
events.headline: 23 Slaves Revolt in New York City

events.originalText: Dutch sailor Jan van Riebeeck landed at Table Bay in Southern Africa, establishing a settlement that later became known as Cape Town.
events.subtitle: Jan van Riebeeck
events.headline: Jan van Riebeeck Establishes Settlement at Table Bay
